Package storesystem.api

This package contains all the Parts to run the back-end of the Store System. Custom Clients should be able to use this API to create their own unique client by using the classes found in this package. The classes that should be created is the ItemRegistry object to create and store a list of items as well as the Inventory to store a store's current Inventory.
Both of these are designed to be capable of creating more than one of these items if necessary as they do not rely on static variables.
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Countable<T>
    Represents an arithmetic-enabled object by adding add and subtract functions.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CartDeals
    this represents the accumulation of deals that will apply
    Inventory
    This is the object in charge of keeping track of the inventory.
    Item
    A basic Item that can be registered using an ItemRegistry
    ItemOrder  
    ItemPack
    This represents a pack of items
    ItemRegistry
    Controls the valid Items as well as creates and stores them.
    ShoppingCart
    The shopping cart object.
    WrappedItem
    Generic Item wrapper class.
    This is used to add extra data to Item's and can be done through the the ItemRegistry with the use of registerWrappedItem() which will save the item the the name in the first String parameter
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CompletedTransactionException
    An exception thrown when the transaction for a ShoppingCart has been completed and a change was attempted.
    ItemNotFoundException
    An item thrown when an item cannot be found
    ItemRegisteredException
    An exception that lets the tester know that an item is already registered
    NotEnoughInOfStockException
    An exception that is throw to let the user know that there is not enough of that item left in the Inventory to purchase the specified quantity
    OutOfStockException
    An exception that is throw to let the user know that there is none of that item left in the Inventory
